main event: On September 3, 1957, at Perrin AFB, Texas, a ground-radar observation reported seven round, bright orange to amber, pulsating gaseous objects moving from north to northwest before disappearing like a light going out.
interesting points: The objects were described as having a nebulous, gaseous appearance, which is unusual for conventional aircraft.
The observation was made by military operators and instructors at the control tower of Perrin Air Force Base, adding credibility to the report.
The objects were noticed during a general observation of the area and disappeared without any noticeable maneuvering.
The report mentioned no physical evidence and suggested that the sightings could be landing lights on low-flying bomber aircraft, indicating an attempt to provide a prosaic explanation.
The document is from Project Blue Book, a U.S. Air Force program to study unidentified flying objects (UFOs), adding historical significance to the report.
sighted object: seven round, bright orange to amber, pulsating gaseous objects
witnesses: military observers: control tower operators, instructors
